passages.text: Thoughts from commods sales/trading below on what they are seeing link, volumes on desk around YTD highs (recall the vol had been sold and it had been grinding sideways....Copper has done the same, flow also picking up here). I also flagged in my daily earlier the GIR primer from last week. London names FRES/ HOC/ EDV, some smaller names still moving SOLG/GGP/RSP, equally the Copper names get a tailwind can argue its a chunk of the ANTO relative YTD.

Gold - Market Primer....Gold is not consumed - it's accumulated. Nearly every ounce ever mined still exists. New annual production adds just over \(1\%\) to the existing stock and is stable and price inelastic. Unlike oil or natural gas - where price balances production and consumption - gold is not consumed. It is stored. That makes these traditional supply- demand models inadequate for gold; its market clears through changes in ownership, not production- versus- use balances....As a rule of thumb, 100 tonnes of net purchases by conviction holders - central banks, speculators, and ETFs - corresponds to a \(1.7\%\) rise in the gold price.
Exhibit 2: We Maintain Our \$4,000/toz Forecast For Mid-2026
Source:Goldman Sachs Global Investment Research

Good re- engagement from Chinese specs overnight as LBMA approaches the ATH; think western macros under positioned given price has ignored all perceived catalysts (US debt, Trump vs Powell etc) until last Thursday / Friday when we saw re- engagement via digis and RKO. Continue to think skew is cheap; we are positioned around 3M tenor (to avoid producer hedging which is \(\sim 2y\) tenor), and get whipped long vega if price takes out the
ATH, which we think will trigger further macro buying (folk stopped into length). Note we' re still \(\sim 5\%\) away from the SHFE gold ATH (which is arguably more important given Chinese volumes).

Side- note: We think the \(\) 20/\(oz EFP rally vs Thursday is because merchants / bullion banks are reluctant / unable to import due to tariff uncertainty, meaning less physical selling against the CMX macro bid.
Gold: \(2^{nd}\) largest single day Oil increase in 3 years (SHFE + SGE + ETF)
Although total Chinese length remains \(\sim 7\%\) off the April high
And onshore volume significantly lower than on \(22^{\text{nd}}\) April when LBMA made an ATH
Similar story in silver as China added 46.5mn oz across SHFE and SGE
And total Chinese positioning significantly off the highs
Source (for all): FICC & Equities, a/o today, past performance not indicative of future results
